millsfield:images_texts:
AIR
CALIFORNIA
737 Emergency Information
FOR YOUR SAFETY If an other-than-normal landing should occur, the airplane is equipped with
the latest evacuation equipment. Below is a floor plan of the airplane you are in. Memorize the
locations of all exits, especially the exits nearest you. Study how they are opened and operated.
During an other-than-normal landing, pay close attention to instructions from the crew and follow
these immediately. Do not go back for coats, purses, or other personal items.
ABOUT YOUR SEAT BELT: Please keep it fastened whenever the seat belt sign is lighted. You
may walk about the cabin when the sign is off; however, you will notice most experienced air
travelers keep their belts loosely fastened whenever they are seated. We recommed this practice.
EXIT LOCATIONS
HOW TO OPEN EXIT DOORS
EXIT DOORS WITH ESCAPE SLIDES
1. Lift Door Handle Up
2. Push Door Out
Exit Door
With Slide
Exit Door
With Slide
3. Pull Red Handle to Inflate Slide
4. Jump and Sit on Slide
Overwing
Window
Exit
Overwing
Window
Exit
Exit Door
With Stair
(See Other Side)
Exit Door
With Slide
OVERWING WINDOW EXITS
1. Pull Cover Open
2. Grasp
Red
Handle, Pull
Inward and Down
3. Entire Window is Then Dis
carded on Wing
4. Exit
Through
Window-
Leg, Body, Leg
PORTABLE ELECTRONIC DEVICES
Are you carring a portable radio or recorder? Federal Aviation Agency (FAA) regulation prohibits
the operation in-flight of certain portable electronic devices since they can interfere with the
aircraft's navigation system. Please check with the stewardess before operating your radio,
dictating machine or recorder.
PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS CARD FROM AIRPLANE.
Form No. AC-199

HOW TO USE THE OXYGEN MASK
Jet aircraft fly at high altitude and the cabin is
pressurized for your comfort. If cabin pressure ever
was lost, you would be breathing high altitude "thin
air"...so it is imperative that cigars and cigarettes
be extinguished immediately and oxygen masks be
put on as shown below.
REAR EXIT DOOR WITH STAIR
RELEASE
1. WHERE TO LOCATE MASKS - Oxygen masks
are located in overhead compartments. If cabin
pressure is lost, doors open automatically and masks
drop out. Promptly place mask over nose and mouth
as follows:
2. GRIP MASK
FIRMLY AND
PULL - Take
nearest mask in hand and pull toward you. This
turns on oxygen and releases oxygen supply tube.
Relax comfortably in seat with mask in place.
1. Pull Release Handle Inward and Down as Far as
Possible.
PLACARD
EXIT
2. Door Opens and Stairs Unfold. When Placard
Becomes Visible, Push Stairs Up and Outward.
3. REMOVE
ELASTIC
BAND
AROUND
MASK - Slip elastic band from around mask. Hold
mask over nose and mouth. Slip band over head, this
holds mask in position.
3. Door Shown in Open Position with Stairs
Unfolded.
4. ADJUST
BAND
FOR
COMFORTABLE
FIT - Mask adjusts easily for comfort. If tight, hold
mask and gently pull band with free hand. If loose,
pull tabs where band connects to mask. Over-
tightening misshapes mask and is uncomfortable.
BRACE POSITION
Bottom Seat Cushion is Floatable.
Grasp at Back and Pull from Seat Frame.
PLEASE DO NOT REMOVE THIS CARD FROM AIRPLANE.
properties.sfomuseum:description: Safety information card issued by Air California for its Boeing 737 fleet; white and orange double-sided tri-fold card with illustrations demonstrating inflight safety and emergency procedures; identification code: AC199; no revision date.
properties.wof:name: safety information card: Air California, Boeing 737
